title: Network Access Control
description: Network access control (NAC), also known as network admission control, is the process of restricting unauthorized users and devices from gaining access to a corporate or private network. NAC ensures that only users who are authenticated and devices that are authorized and compliant with security policies can enter the network.
key-ideas: Agented requires an application installed on end-user devices that actively scan and monitor the host for policy violations.
Agentless relies on a device or service monitoring the network activity and visible services.
NAC might require: fully patched OS and applications, no unauthorized applications, proper group and user policies, virus free.
